image.altText: Headshot of woman in jacket from side

props.synopsis: NT Opposition Leader Selena Uibo held a press conference on Friday to disclose the misuse, just days after travel logs were released to the ABC through Freedom of Information.

title.children: NT Labor leader misuses taxpayer-funded chauffeur service for private trips

image.altText: A close up shot of white woman, blonde shoulder length hair, light brown framed glasses, wearing a khaki green blazer.

props.synopsis: The NT's attorney-general says she is focused on protecting victims regardless of their cultural background and questions allegations that the government's suite of crime reforms is targeting Aboriginal Territorians.

title.children: NT politician says 'it's not racist to want a safer community'

image.altText: Two people, man and woman in blue polo shirts that read 'TPS Security' walking towards a group of people in public park

props.synopsis: There's been a spike in reports of violent and anti-social incidents in the CBD, as Darwin businesses call for more government investment in late-night security patrols.

title.children: Darwin workers, tourists spat at and abused after security patrol hours cut

image.altText: a bushfire at night, with the whole scene lit up red, sparks flying.

props.synopsis: The fire threatened communities, destroyed more than 3,500km of fencing and cost the NT's cattle industry an estimated $120 million.

title.children: Review highlights 'near misses' in bushfire that killed 37,000 cattle

image.altText: An older woman wearing glasses and wearing a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Robyne Burridge lives with a disability that severely impacts her mobility, and hydrotherapy is vital. But she hasn't received that treatment in months after the NT government cut off public access to the only suitable local facility.

title.children: Disability advocate goes without hydrotherapy after access to pool changes

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy standing at a lectern and looking up.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into recruitment processes for senior NT police positions recommends "significant improvements", noting there are "widely held beliefs" that "bias", "favouritism" and "nepotism" have impacted promotions within the force.

title.children: NT police recruitment processes need 'significant improvements', review finds

image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: The prison guards' union and a criminal lawyer say a government "delay" in building a separate women's prison in Alice Springs is increasing overcrowding and leaving female inmates too close to male prisoners.

title.children: Women at risk from male inmates in crowded prison, advocates say

image.altText: Two rows of guns lined up in a storage room.

props.synopsis: A Kakadu National Park firearms dealer faces charges by NT Police for failing to properly store hundreds of guns being kept on a property at the park.

title.children: 81-year-old firearms dealer has 240 guns seized in Kakadu National Park

image.altText: A poster for a film shows characters against a blue sky and red dirt landscape, with the words: Last Cab to Darwin.

props.synopsis: The director of Last Cab to Darwin — which explores the subject of voluntary assisted dying — wants all terminally ill Australians to be afforded access to dignified end-of-life care.

title.children: Last Cab to Darwin's story on VAD hits home for director on 10 year anniversary

image.altText: collage of document extracts layer over square colour photo of smiling female teacher and young student wearing hat

props.synopsis: Even after putting a stop to their abuser's access to students, Alliyah faced an uphill battle to get basic information about what had happened behind the scenes.

title.children: Sexual predator taught in Brisbane schools for nine years after parents' complaints

image.altText: A close up photo of Tony Mokbel.

props.synopsis: The drug kingpin has had a mixed result in his appeal against three convictions, with a possible retrial looming.

title.children: Gangland figure Mokbel faces retrial after spending 6,500 days in prison

image.altText: James Cameron

props.synopsis: The Hollywood director has been present in the film space for many years but the emergence of AI and its power has him somewhat scared for the future.

title.children: 'Not sci-fi anymore': James Cameron's AI warning

image.altText: vladimir putin raises his hand as he sits behind a microphone

props.synopsis: The Russian president says it is NATO that is the "paper tiger," and "if anyone still has a desire to compete with us in the military sphere, as we say, feel free, let them try".

title.children: Putin swipes back at Trump's 'paper tiger' comment

image.altText: Police operation in a suburban street.

props.synopsis: NSW Police said a member of the public reported seeing four people, one of whom appeared to be carrying a gun, leave a dark-coloured sedan or station wagon and go into a home on the street.

title.children: Hunt for 'aggressive, dangerous men' who slipped Sydney police operation

image.altText: Three in scenery

props.synopsis: In the 41 years since the first Australians summitted Mount Everest, the mountain has been transformed into a tourist attraction. Does the original magic still exist?

title.children: The 'Australian Route' up Mt Everest that may never be repeated

image.altText: A composite of an Asian woman with brown hair wearing pearls and holding up a finger, and Shinjiro Koizum, an Asian man smiling.

props.synopsis: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is stepping down as leader after only a year in the role. It has left his party looking for a new face — and the frontrunner options could not be more different.

title.children: Inflation and Trump changed Japan. Could an 'Iron Lady' or a political scion save it?

image.altText: SES volunteers walk through sparse bushland

props.synopsis: The search for missing four-year-old Gus has entered its seventh day, with no new signs of the boy.

title.children: Community comes together as search for missing 4yo Gus enters day 7

image.altText: A stormwater drain

props.synopsis: The City of Yarra mayor has lashed the government over the mapping, saying residents will bear the costs of inadequate infrastructure investment.

title.children: New Melbourne flood mapping sparks outrage from inner-city council

image.altText: ASX board viewed behind a person's head walking past window

props.synopsis: The ASX has made modest gains after trading flat early on, as a slide for energy producers offset gains for industrial, healthcare and tech stocks. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX rises as DigiCo surges, Telstra fined $18m over misleading customers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ANZ rules out another interest rate cut in 2025
'Housing crisis hidden in plain sight' in Western Sydney, new report finds

image.altText: A shirt and singlet hanging next to each other in muted colour tones. Both look soft to touch.

props.synopsis: Scientists, farmers and the fashion industry collaborate to create a natural fabric that is both woven and knitted, low on emissions and set to shake up how we think about clothing.

title.children: Hope new fabric will revitalise Australian textile manufacturing

image.altText: A line of cars behind a truck in Wodonga.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old girl has died in a crash involving an allegedly stolen car in Wodonga, as police investigate two deadly collisions in Victoria's north in the space of 12 hours.

title.children: Teenage girl dies in crash involving allegedly stolen car

image.altText: A woman reaches out to an alarm clock from bed.

props.synopsis: Here's your quick pocket guide on daylight saving as Australia comes into the warmer months.

title.children: Daylight saving time starts on Sunday. Here's when clocks go forward and where

image.altText: A brown bug with vivid red and blue stripes on its abdomen.

props.synopsis: Whether you love beetles or the giant mantis it's time to cast your vote for Australia's top insect.

title.children: Vote for your favourite Australian Insect of the Year

image.altText: Fairy lights glow from behind plastic sheets on a building that says "Punka Pub" at dusk.

props.synopsis: Businesses hurt by stay-away orders issued during the search for alleged police killer Dezi Freeman say they have yet to receive the government support they were promised.

title.children: As the Dezi Freeman manhunt drags on, so do the dark days in Porepunkah

image.altText: Reece Walsh directs prayer hands at the Lang Park crowd.

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Test your news knowledge to see how much you remember for the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A game-winning shot, a Hollywood separation and a shock shutdown

image.altText: a picture of a river bordered by trees looking towards the horizon on a clear day.

props.synopsis: An algal bloom causing toxic foam and fish kills along South Australia's beaches prompts holiday-makers to consider alternative summer travel plans.

title.children: Holiday-makers swap the beach for the river to avoid algal bloom

image.altText: Gold bars piled on a wooden pallet.

props.synopsis: The gold-mining sector is set to boost WA's economy, with 2,400 new jobs forecast over the next five years compared to 1,200 in iron ore.

title.children: WA enters golden era for mining jobs as investment booms

image.altText: Coaches

props.synopsis: Craig Bellamy and Michael Maguire know each other better than most NRL coaches, and that familiarity will play a major part in how they tackle the NRL grand final.

title.children: How two old footy heads will battle it out via mind games and magic

image.altText: A woman wearing headphones and flowers in her hair looks at her phone in a room of people wearing headphones.

props.synopsis: The global COP climate talks have been a source of frustration and disappointment for Pacific nations. They hope hosting the event will change that.

title.children: COP is 'heartbreak' for the Pacific. Here's why they still want to host

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: A Labor factional heavyweight is making the case for more federal politicians and longer, fixed parliamentary terms.

title.children: If these reforms succeed, Australia could have more politicians

image.altText: A senior woman and chimpanzee, separated by glass, leaning towards each other with pursed lips as if to kiss

props.synopsis: In the chimp world, there was the time before Jane Goodall and the time after. This is the reason we knew so little about the great ape before 1960, according to the woman who dedicated her life to humankind's closest cousins.

title.children: 'Of course I fell in love': Why Jane Goodall dedicated her life to chimps

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt

props.synopsis: Sydney Metro construction once made John Finucane's home "uninhabitable" for two years. Now he has been told to expect 24-hour hammering.

title.children: Residents told to expect 24-hour drilling for Sydney Metro construction

image.altText: A pothole on a road in the foreground and three cars drive in the background  on roads.

props.synopsis: New data obtained by the ABC under Freedom of Information laws show the majority of claims for compensation by drivers encountering hazards on Victorian roads are being rejected.

title.children: Just 1 per cent of state's road damage compensation claims approved

image.altText: A line of large green tractors with political signs protesting imports.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian potato farmers have rejected a second pay offer from multinational processor Simplot that would see farmers paid less per kilo than last year.

title.children: Tractor convoy unable to break Tasmanian potato pay stalemate
